column4: I'm trying to upgrade 10.10 to 11.04. It fails with "Could not calculate the upgrade". I googled for this and found lots of suggestions, but nothing that worked. Has anyone found a workaround for this error?
how are you trying to do this? from console tried: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade 0 after editing /etc/apt/sources.list ?
I was using the update manager, but I'll try your suggestion.
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade 0 worked... Now trying the upgrade from the update manager.
same problem. I'm not sure that I've gotten rid of enough repositories from /etc/apt/sources.list. Any ideas about how to tell which ones are necessary?
the ones that are necessary are the ones ubuntu provides.
relevant to your version of choice
ok, but how can I tell which ones are ones that ubuntu provides? Most of them refer to mirrors, not canonical.com.
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+archivemirrors
Thanks.

I looked at the list and my sources.list. All but one entry in sources.list pointed to mirrors.se.eu.kernel.org. The one exception pointed to archive.canonical.com. I commented that out and am retrying.
the crux of the version upgrade is that you must change the name from lucid to orenic for example
While the package manager is running, it replaces the sources.list file with a new one that has s/maverick/natty. When it fails, it reverts it.
It's still failing in the same way. The sources.list entries all look OK. Any other ideas? The apt.log has a lot of lines like this:
Broken xul-ext-ubufox:amd64 Depends on apturl-kde [ amd64 ] < none -> 0.4.2ubuntu5.1 > ( admin )
Considering apturl-kde:amd64 1 as a solution to xul-ext-ubufox:amd64 12
Try Installing apturl-kde [ amd64 ] < none -> 0.4.2ubuntu5.1 > ( admin ) before changing xul-ext-ubufox:amd64
Installing kdesudo as Depends of apturl-kde
Installing software-properties-kde as Depends of apturl-kde
Or group remove for xul-ext-ubufox:amd64
in apt.log, I'm seeing a lot of errors like: Broken <packagename>:amd64  Depnds on <packagename> [ amd64 ] ...
